abstract: Representative Barney Frank, the head of the Financial Services Committee, bans staff contact with a former assistant who left for a firm that stands to benefit from financial legislation he helped write.
snippet: Representative Barney Frank, the head of the Financial Services Committee, bans staff contact with a former assistant who left for a firm that stands to benefit from financial legislation he helped write.
lead_paragraph: 6:53 p.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Sewell Chan provides more details in this article about Barney Frank’s rebuke of a former committee adviser.

headline.main: Frank Bans Ex-Adviser From Dealing With Panel
